result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE left voicemail at 10:41 AM stating that she didn't have the zoom information for today's hearing and thought she had a warrant. Clerk returned call at 3:50 PM and advised DE that the hearing early today was in person, not zoom, and a warrant was issued due to her non-appearance. Clerk gave DE PD's #.  gll

1:23 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah Marie Garofalo in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Sarah Marie Garofalo for today. Includes 22CM188 INIT, 22CM2 RW, 21CM305 RW, and 22CF229 RW. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights in 22CM188. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG plea in 22CM188. DE confirms address and DOB. Court QUASHES WARRANTS. Court questions non-appearance. DE state she had COVID and sent fax, but states second page wasn't rec'd. Bond argument; bond ordered in 22CM188. Court reinstates bond in 22CM2, 21CM305, and 22CF229. Adjourned at 1:34 PM.  gll

01:31 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  Tyler W. Brennan (21CM305) and Abriana Dolfi (22CM02), DF: Sarah Marie Garofalo did not appear. INCLUDES 21CM305 (Set for PLEAS) and 22CM02 (Set for STC). Court reviews file, notes previous letter regarding medical status. Atty. Dolfi states that she has been in contact with DE, has information that DE's transportation was unable to get her to court today. State requests warrant, states DE has not been complying with JSC conditions. Atty. Brennan and Dolfi requests stayed warrant. Court issues warrant, body only - STAYED until 2/3 @ 1:15 PM, DE in person, atty approved by Zoom. Court sets plea/sentencing hearing. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Dolfi appointed. hml
from DE re: Setting up Justice Support Center. To rg for EFV's review. hml
Pretrial Assessment Report. SEALED.  gll
Status conference on January 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Defendant to test clean before release EXCEPT THC.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least 1 time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kozy Korner or Jeremy O.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
